CCEP Manager

  • Quick start
  • View page source

Quick start

CCEP Manager is a BIDS app allowing the processing of iEEG data coupled with electrical stimulation for the extraction of CCEP features and the generation of connectivity atlases.

Before you start

Prepare your working environment

CCEP Manager requires MatLab 2015b Runtime (9.0) as it is used for data processing, whereas AnyWave and HiBoP softwares are optional but recommended for data visualization and reviewing.

Prepare your data

CCEP Manager is a BIDS app and only works on a valid BIDS database as it uses BIDS directory tree and file naming conventions to gather inputs and generate outputs in adequate derivative folders. Accordingly, iEEG data should either be in BrainVision format or European Data Format.

Stimulation events in iEEG files should use the following labelling convention :

<label1> <label2> <intensity> mA <frequency> Hz <pulse width> us

(e.g.: Bp02 Bp03 3mA 1Hz 1000us)

iEEG data need to be paired with implantation file(s) that specify electrode coordinates and corresponding cortical parcels. Implantation file(s) should be prepared using the IntrAnat software.

Data processing

The processing pipeline consists in 4 sequential steps:

  1. Implantation step

  2. Preprocessing step

  3. Cropping step

  4. Features step

Each step produces substantially different outputs which can be explored using various tools. The last features step, allows the computation of connectivity atlases.

Setting things up

Start CCEP Manager double clicking the executable file and specify dependencies for your system once for all clicking and selecting the DEPENDENCIES option (). A popup will appear allowing to specify () the paths of both AnyWave and HiBoP executable files. Don’t forget to save modifications clicking before closing the popup.

Then, specify the active BIDS database by browsing () and selecting the root directory of the appropriate BIDS database.

Once a valid BIDS database is selected the interface will update showing the list of subjects and the status of each processing step in the form of an interactive table.

Define a processing pipeline

Cells from the interactive table are selectable and a number of contextual actions can be performed on the active selection. Select the first 3 steps of a subject who has the iEEG data you would like to process and for which the corresponding implantation file(s) have been prepared. Then, right click the table and select the RUN option () from the contextual menu to spawn the data processing interface.

Configure and execute processing steps

The data processing interface lets you configure the steps you have previously chosen in the interactive table. Selecting a subject allows to configure the step parameters in the corresponding tab.

The implantation step parameters propose various drop down lists, corresponding to BIDS iEEG entities, (key-value pairs) in order to filter the iEEG data to process from the BIDS database. Click on the Implantation file button to browse and select the implantation file (*.csv) that will be matched with the filtered iEEG data.

To configure the other steps, please refer to CCEP Manager full documentation which contain in-depth description of the processing steps and associated parameters. If you are unsure, keep the default values.

Clicking RUN () will execute the pipeline. Processing logs will be display in real-time in the REPORT area. In the meantime, it is possible to define an other pipeline and process data following the same approach.

Perform quality control

Once data processing is over, click to refresh the table.

At this point, stimulation periods in iEEG files have been detected and cropped into individual files. However, the cropping step is because the cropped stimulations need to be qualitatively controlled and validated first.

Select the cropping step and then the TIME SERIES option () after clicking .

The popup illustrated below allows the selection of one or multiple cropped stimulations to DISPLAY () in AnyWave.

In AnyWave, you can edit the montage and specify bad channels as illustrated below.

Once a cropped stimulation has been carefully reviewed in AnyWave, VALIDATE it clicking . Once all the cropped stimulations are validated, refresh () the interactive table so statuses are updated and the cropping step shows as , meaning it is ready for CCEP computation and feature extraction.

Extract CCEP features

Once the cropped stimulations have been qualitatively controlled and validated, the cropping step is . It is possible to execute the features step which will extract CCEPs features. Following the same procedure as before, click the features step in the table, then select the RUN option () from the contextual menu (right click) to initiate the data processing interface. From there, it is possible to configure the step in the corresonding tab and execute the one-step pipeline clicking the RUN button ().

Results and visualizations

Each processing step generates output files (mostly MATLAB/SPM object files) stored in the /derivatives/ccep_manager directory of the active BIDS database. Please refer to the data processing chapter for the exact location and detailed description of the output files.

You can access several tools by clicking , which is available for each processing step:

  • The TIME SERIES tool () is accessible for both the preprocessing and cropping steps. An interface allows the selection of one or several preprocessed iEEG file or cropped stimulations to be displayed in AnyWave.

  • The CCEP tool () is only accessible for the cropping step. The cropped stimulations will be assigned to an HiBoP project that will be automatically loaded in the HiBoP software in order to visualize CCEPs in 3D.

  • The FEATURES tool () is only accessible for the features step. It can be used to store the various scores extracted from CCEP features into convenient text (*.txt) files.

  • The ATLAS tool () is only accessible for the features step. It can be used to generate connectivity atlases computed from CCEP features.
